abstract: The maker of heart devices agreed to pay $268 million to settle “virtually all” claims in the United States over defective defibrillator wires.
snippet: The maker of heart devices agreed to pay $268 million to settle “virtually all” claims in the United States over defective defibrillator wires.
lead_paragraph: Medtronic, the maker of heart devices, agreed to pay $268 million to settle lawsuits over claims that fractured wires in a line of its cardiac defibrillators caused at least 13 deaths.

headline.main: Medtronic to Settle Lawsuits Over Devices Tied to Deaths
headline.print_headline: Medtronic to Settle Lawsuits Over Devices Tied to Deaths
